story:
Once upon a time, in a beautiful village nestled between rolling hills and whispering streams, there was a young boy named Samuel. Samuel lived with his father, a kind and wise carpenter named Joseph. Joseph would often tell Samuel stories about their faith and the miracles of Jesus.

One night, as the stars danced in the sky and the moon cast a gentle glow over the village, Samuel asked his father, "Daddy, do you think Jesus still performs miracles today?" Joseph smiled and replied, "Yes, my son. Jesus' love and miracles are always present, even if we cannot see them with our eyes."

So, Joseph decided to tell Samuel a special bedtime story about a time when Jesus walked on water. Samuel listened intently as Joseph described how Jesus calmed the turbulent sea and reassured his disciples who were afraid. "Just like Jesus calmed the storm for his disciples, he can calm any storm in our lives if we have faith and trust in him," Joseph said.

As Samuel drifted off to sleep, he felt the presence of Jesus' love surrounding him like a warm embrace. And in his dreams, he saw Jesus walking beside him, guiding him through life's challenges with grace and peace.

And so, with faith in his heart and the love of Jesus shining brightly within him, Samuel fell into a peaceful slumber, knowing that he was never alone and that miracles were always possible with God's infinite love.

The end. Goodnight, dear Samuel. Remember, Jesus is always with you, guiding you and protecting you with his love. Sleep well, my son. Amen.
